headline: Equifax (EFX) Valuation Reassessed After Recent Share Price Pullback
summary: Equifax (EFX) is back in focus after recent share price pressure, with the stock down over the past month and past 3 months. This has prompted investors to reassess its current valuation and business momentum. See our latest analysis for Equifax. The recent pullback has been sharp, with a 30 day share price return of an 18% decline and a 1 year total shareholder return of a 32.47% loss, which suggests momentum has been fading despite the latest rebound to US$181.04. If Equifax's recent swings...

headline: IQVIA Q4 Earnings & Revenues Beat Estimates, Increase Y/Y
summary: IQV posted a fourth-quarter 2025 earnings and revenue beat with double-digit Y/Y sales growth, strong segment gains and upbeat 2026 revenue guidance.

headline: Morning Movers: Eli Lilly rises, Boston Scientific falls after quarterly results
summary: Stock futures are mixed and have shown modest signs of stabilization after a sharp downturn in software and AI-related technology stocks yesterday, prompting some investors to treat the technology selloff that pressured equities broadly as a buying opportunity. Against that backdrop, defensive sectors and commodity-linked assets have drawn interest, particularly as gold reclaimed levels above $5,000 an ounce, reflecting continued demand for safe havens amid uncertainty. headline: Is Equifax (EFX) Now An Opportunity After A 32% One Year Share Price Slide?
summary: If you are wondering whether Equifax at around US$181 per share still makes sense for your portfolio, the real question is what you are getting for that price. The stock is down about 11.8% over the last week, 18.0% over the last month, 15.4% year to date, and 32.5% over the past year, with a 3 year return of a 16.0% decline and a 5 year return of 2.5%. These moves have come as investors continue to reassess credit reporting and data services companies against a backdrop of evolving...

headline: Equifax Q4 Earnings Call Highlights
summary: Equifax (NYSE:EFX) reported a fourth-quarter finish that management said exceeded its prior guidance and set up “strong momentum” entering 2026, even as U.S. mortgage and hiring markets remained uneven. On the call, executives also focused heavily on how rising FICO mortgage score royalty pass-throu

headline: EFX Q4 Deep Dive: AI-Powered Expansion and Government Momentum Offset Margin Headwinds
summary: Credit reporting giant Equifax (NYSE:EFX) reported Q4 CY2025 results exceeding the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 9.2% year on year to $1.55 billion. Guidance for next quarter’s revenue was optimistic at $1.61 billion at the midpoint, 2.5% above analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $2.09 per share was 1.8% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Salesforce stock gets brutal reality check amid software slump
